text: Agenda is a city in Republic County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 47 people lived there. ==History== Agenda (formerly Neva) was planned out in 1887 on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad line. The name Agenda comes from Latin, meaning "â€œwhat ought to be done". The post office in Agenda was ended in 1998. ==Geography== Agenda is at (39.706567, -97.432239). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 47 people, 27 households, and 15 families living in Agenda. Of the households, 85.2% owned their home and 14.8% rented their home. The median age was 61.3. Of the people, 85.1% were White, 4.3% were Native American, and 8.5% were two or more races. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 68 people, 29 households, and 18 families living in Agenda. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Agenda - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 109, local school district ;Maps * Agenda City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:1887 establishments in Kansas
title: Agenda, Kansas
